title: The Persistence of Memory
subject: Melting clocks, dreamlike landscape
description: This iconic painting by Dalí features a surreal landscape where clocks appear to melt and distort in the desert heat, symbolizing the relativity of time. The work is widely recognized as one of the most famous surrealist paintings in the world.

provenance.details: The painting was part of a private collection before being displayed in various international exhibitions.

exhibitions.title: The International Surrealist Exhibition
exhibitions.description: Dalí's work was featured in one of the first large exhibitions of Surrealist art.

exhibitions.title: Dalí's Masterpieces
exhibitions.description: A retrospective showcasing Dalí's major works, including 'The Persistence of Memory'.

restorations.details: The painting underwent a careful cleaning process to preserve its visual integrity.

images.caption: The Persistence of Memory, Salvador Dalí, 1931

priceHistory.details: Sold at auction as part of a surrealism-themed collection.

ownershipHistory.details: Acquired directly from the artist during Dalí's lifetime.
Donated by a private collector in the 1960s.
